First time i came here, the food was exceptional but the company was not LOL -  so came back to try it with better company :) A typical Italian staple with a-typical twist on food.  Food is always good. Wine List more than acceptable.  Options on handmade pasta are great. I wish they had more vegetarian options.  They will not allow substitutions on their specials. I wanted one of their hand made pastas with a difference sauce  - the one they offer has lobster on it -  and i dont eat fish. They refused. needless to say thats their choice and with a busy kitchen i can understand. I dont hold them accountable for that.  Their pricing is also great.  $250 for the two of us with drinks... not bad, back in Beverly Hills it would have been $500. Will be visiting this restaurant again and again.

Honestly not sure how this place got so many reviews .. My girlfriends and I didn't really enjoy our experience and the food just tasted blend . The hand crafted pasta were very disappointed , not much flavor .. also the filet mignon were so rough and chewy , too much sauce for our taste . Mostly everyone worked there were being very nice to us besides our server .. and the wine pairing with the meal was horrible choice ! Never had such bad red wine in my life , literally tasted  like water mixed cheap red wine ..  this place is way overrated..

This restaurant had hardly anyone here for lunch today and I think I know why...the prices are too expensive.  All of the special pastas were $35-$38...for lunch!  The atmosphere is nice, the service was good and the food was tasty, but just too expensive!  Ended up splitting a spinach salad and a pasta and the portion was perfect for two!
Pasta texture was great but nothing memorable about the sauce....won't be coming back.

I had a great experience at Marcellino!   There is indoor and outdoor seating. I love the atmosphere. We had live music!   This was the best that I had while I was in the area. Sun-dried tomato pasta with shrimp!

delicious! got the strappazata with broccoli rabe in a white wine sauce with slices of garlic.  noodles were white and orange colored which made it look pretty.  they were chewy and had great texture! it was loaded with broccoli rabe which was awesome! i love broccoli rabe!  simple and delicious!

Food is good but way overrated.  The service is nothing special and the prices are astronomical for the quality and quantity of food that you get.  Don't get me wrong the food is good but when you put it all together it is just OK and you may be happier going elsewhere.
Wonderful experience Wait staff was fabulous,food and wine outstanding. Will recommend this for sure

Leopald was a fantastic waiter who knew the menu and genuinely loved to share his insight on this delicious food, beverages, and the chef's story and accolades. A European style manner of serving (low pressure with an emphasis on providing a great culinary experience). From our water glasses constantly being refilled, wine being poured, to bringing out fresh silverware and side plates between courses was constantly being done without ever needing to ask. The service was GREAT. The current pasta specials were presented and what they were paired with was explained. Next time we will have to get the gnocchi. There were options for vegetarians, meat lovers, and seafood eaters. The desserts we tried were also very good. We went with a group of friends and the atmosphere was good for both groups or it could have also worked well for a date night. Just in case, I would recommend making a reservation because it started to get a little busy/fill up even on a Monday night. The location is great, a parking garage right below, and the ambience was very nice (not too casual, but not at all stuffy). We will definitely be back!

I love Italian cuisine, so naturally my boyfriend chose Italian for Valentine's Day! Busy busy busy atmosphere in oldtown Scottsdale for this special day, we got excited walking up to the door seeing how beautiful the decor was at Marcellino's. Now both my boyfriend and I have each worked in the Scottsdale restaurant industry for over 5+ years, and working on Valentine's Day stinks for sure, so we get that everyone isn't really in their "best service moods" but that shouldn't be an acceptable out for not caring about all the people who are about to spend a good amount of money on their special night out at your restaurant! At least fake a smile, and make us think that you care about our experience. Our reservation was at 6:45- we were seated promptly, but the hostess was "blah"... Not a word left her mouth on the walk/seating to our table. About 30 seconds after being sat, a man offered us a bottle of still water to begin with, he was very polite, and I was disappointed to find out he was only the busser/serving assistant because his welcome was probably the best part of our whole meal. Waitress walks up, "Hello, what can I get you started to drink?" No name, no suggestions for a bottle of wine or champagne, oh well. We ordered two cocktails along with the mozzarella and prosciutto appetizer to start. We were told that if we separated our order- aka start with the app, then our entrees are going to take a "very long time to arrive"... Um, okay, we are now feeling rushed and uncomfortable. Drinks come about 12 mins later, appetizer tasted like store bought cheese with a strip of prosciutto ($19.95 I believe, ugh?!), another "blah"... Entrees are ordered, the gnocchi (which was very good and full of flavor) and a seafood dish including some delicious frozen calamari... :/ Dessert and coffee were then offered, we figured it might be best to get a McDonald's ice cream cone on the way home and save the $14. As were waiting for the check to arrive, here comes my favorite server assistant again! He asked how our meals were, if he could clear our plates, etc. ALL while maintaining a smile. The only one I've seen all night. I wanted to give him a hug. All in all, $143 before gratuity for an average meal. No goodbye or thanks for coming in as we were leaving from the host stand/what looked to be a floor manager. We were pretty bummed with this whole experience. "Blah"

Went to Marcellino with a large dinging group (about 18 people).  We were seated promptly even though we didn't have a reservation.  Our waiter was very good about keeping all of our orders separate, and he was even able to prepare separate checks for each person in the party.  Excellent service. Restaurant was very dark, but from what I could see seemed to be nicely decorated.  It was not too noisy.  I had the Strozzaprete ai Broccoli di Rape.  The pasta was supposed to be two colors, but I had trouble seeing it in the dim dining room.  Although I couldn't see my food, I could taste it, and it did taste delicious!  The noodles were perfectly cooked and nicely chewy.  However, $22.95 seemed like a LOT of money for a bowl of pasta.

Insanely good food paired with top-notch service, ambiance and the loveliest hostess! Sima, Marcellino and the entire staff make this restaurant our favorite location for special occasions. Homemade everything - the pasta is always a favorite for us. We had our wedding dinner here, 5 years ago, with a small group of family and close friends and it was wonderful. Amazing servers really know their business and can recommend wine pairings and their favorite dishes.   The new location in Old Town Scottsdale is more convenient to where we live, though we were just as happy to drive a bit further to the original location. I've chosen "dressy" and "not" good for kids, only based on how we like to experience Marcellino's, though they are so welcoming and comfortable I'm sure casual dress and (well behaved!) kids would be just as welcome... if you tend to spoil your kids, that is.

This place is off the charts!  Awesome food, service, and ambiance.  I got the salmon and shared some of the spinach ravioli - killer combo!  Served us as a table of 12 and exceeded our expectations!  Don't forget the cheesecake!

Marcellino Ristorante is one of my favorite Italian restaurant  here in Scottsdale.   Their pasta are all hand made.  Number of their pasta dishes all came with truffles.  Their sun dried red pepper with egg plant puree spread for the bread is so tasty..  The food here is authentic and delicious.   I definitely will come back.
Absolutely fabulous. The fresh pasta is incredible. The atmosphere inside and out is great for groups or romantic dinners. We had the black truffle filet ravioli and it was unbelievable.

I dined here a couple of weeks ago for a friends birthday. I have to admit that the thought of handmade pasta had me all excited. I thought the atmosphere was nice although it was a tad dark in there...I do actually like to see my food. I found the display of dishes that they bring to your table kind of weird...I don't need to see it...just describe it to me. I also felt like having 6 specials to go over is a bit much...I'm not huge on lengthy waiter/diner interaction - I go to restaurants with either my boyfriend or family or friends and that's who I want to talk to. I'm always polite and I tip well but I don't want to spend all of my time hearing about the menu.   As for the food - I have absolutely  no doubt that they use the highest quality ingredients. I had the gnocchi and while it was obviously  made well the flavor didn't blow me away. Potato dumplings are not exactly bursting with flavor so you need a sauce that tastes awesome - this was just a basic marinara and some mozzarella mixed in. I honestly far preferred the gnocchi dish they served at PastaBar downtown...I have not found anything that compares.   Obviously this is a good restaurant and I don't mean to take away from that but for me it just wasn't a hit - especially considering the cost.

Definitely an amazing restaurant, Sima and Chef Marcellino took great care of me and my date. The atmosphere is plush and romantic, i had the chef's tasting menu. Their hand made pasta is absolutely delicious.  Also on either Friday or Saturdays, they have live Opra at the restaurant which is an amazing treat.

This place has good italian food for phoenix, but thats because the only real competition is Olive Garden and Carabbas. If this place were any place else like San Fran it would be done. I mean $30 - 40 for pasta? Come on now... Way overpriced and not that tasty.

The concierge at the Hotel Valley Ho told us that this was one of the finer and better Italian restaurants in Town - she was right.  Having dined around the world, this is by far in my top 5 of all time Italian restaurants.  1. Atmosphere - cozy, intimate and great Italian music 2. Fresh made pasta - do I need to say more 3. A wine list that rivals any 5 star hotel selection 4. Service, Service, Service - Phenomenal wait staff 5. The Chef - Marcellino knows his stuff, great character.  Tips - Ink infused fettuccine with Lobster is probably the best dish I have had in years. Order the rare but 100 point Barollo - It is worth the $ 200.00 a bottle.  But again - service, service, service.  Finally a restaurant that does everything right.
Simply a fantastic meal.  Great service.  Excellent chianti.  Perfect tiramisu.  One of the best dinners I've had in the Valley.

Expertly crafted fresh pasta is always a joy.  I went to Marcellino's this past weekend with my wife and some close friends and I have to say the evening was an experience.  Everything about this place screamed romantic Italian dinner from the live music to the tucked away location set back behind Barrio Queen in Old Town.  In many ways the presentation is a throwback to decadent dining where they bring you a view plate of the pasta before the meal while the well trained waiter tells the story of each type of noodle and the delicious dish its served with.  It's something that I enjoy because it reminds me that I'm dining out, and this is a meal that isn't to be rushed.  The food they make here takes time and should be enjoyed accordingly and slowly perhaps with an accompaniment of a few bottles of carefully selected Italian wine. I ended up going with the squid ink pasta with muscles, clams, and half lobster tail in a flavorful red sauce.  In my opinion they had me at squid ink, but beyond that everything was quality, and the juice from the fresh clams and muscles gave a nice seafood flavor to the sauce.  Pricing is what you should expect for the ambience and quality of food.  I could see myself coming here every few months because the pasta, and the fact that the chef/owner took the time to come out and ask us how our meal was.  It shows that he truly cares and that he's confident in the product that he's turning out.

I ate here a few months ago with 3 co-workers and loved everything about the experience. We had several pasta of the day choices and were pleased with all of them. The limoncella was excellent and house made. Pricey, but worth it.

By far, THE best Italian food, wine, beer, etc. that I have ever tasted in my life. My wife and I enjoy the food every single time. Food has been perfect every single order -- consistently over months of visiting. Marcellino's will not let you down and will meet your expectations...and then some. Great staff who are very menu savvy and the customer service is superb.

Went here on the basis of the reviews on this site for our anniversary (thanks Gabi).  It was a perfect choice.  From the reservation process, through the parking, to the live band playing just outside, the beginning of the evening was perfect.  Once inside the ambience was excellent.  Their was an intimacy to the venue which was, for fear of being redundent, excellent.  The hosts were friendly and attentive, and our server, Scott, was wonderful.  And the food.  Wow.  We actually ordered two of the specials, and they were amazing... my wife had a pasta dish in a lobster sauce which was perfect... thought she was going to lick her plate at the end.  I had the ground steak gnocchi, which was cooked to perfection.  Both were simply delicious.  They had a very nice wine selection (we had the prosecco), and the espresso which topped the evening off was again, perfect.  This is definitely on my short list of the best restaurants in Phoenix.
Love this place. Great food and atmosphere.  A little pricey for the pastas but homemade and worth it!

By far and away the best Italian food in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area.   I have been going to this restaurant for the longesdt time and will not eat Italian food anywhere else. Pasta made fresh every day and knowledgable and attentive workers around to make certain everything is perfect. Make a reservation and be sure to be there on Saturday nights as the live music will make you want to stay for hours.  The singer has a fantastic voice with great traditional songs

Love this place ! The owners are very friendly and make you feel welcome. It feels like you're in a NYC Italian restaurant. :-) Food is creative and delicious . Service is great. We keep coming back !  You really should try it.  Either as a couple or as a group - this place works.

Marcellino Ristorante is a truly excellent Italian restaurant. There are many options especially in Scottsdale for fine dining, especially if one craves Italian cuisine. However, one seldom finds as complete a package as Marcellino. The combination of ambience, charming decor, impeccable service, and flavorful dishes makes this an excellent choice if you are bringing a date or celebarting a special occasion. Try the homemade pasta, trust me it is to die for. They also have a version of chicken saltimboca (can't remember the menu name) that is heavenly. If you dine al fresco, you might get some live music blaring from Tapas Papa Frita, which is either a plus or minus depending on your threshold for music volume. Prices are somewhat high, but is within the expected range for a classy Scottsdale establishment. One downside is that I would not recommend the mussels appetizer as the mussels are tiny. The desserts are homemade and decent although not something I would write home about. Truly the main course is the crown jewel of this establishment's menu, but don't get me wrong - the appetizers and desserts (that we tried) are fine, just not up to the standard of the rest of the restaurant.

Clean, upscale place for a meal.  Nothing was outstanding.  Fresh pasta with red bell pepper, shrimp and scallops was a bit "fishy" and just ok. Flatline. Indifferent. Overpriced.  The wine list was limited, but perhaps because of its exclusive Italian-only wines. Dessert just ok. Jazz band had an ear piercing singer--so couldn't hear conversation at our table.  Restroom auto-on faucet didn't work right so had a hard time getting soap off my hands. Service good until the end....took a while to clear off our dirty plates.  Don't think I'd return but not a bad place.

Had a fantastic dinner at Marcellino's last night.  Everything was perfect, including a Grey Goose Martini!  The waiter was very efficient, came by our table just the right amount of time.  We shared a Caprese antipasto.  Wonderful!.  Then shared a pasta dish that wasn't on the menu.  It was a large, flat-squared pasta with an amazing truffle sauce.  To die for!  For our main course we also shared the Scaloppine al Gorgonzola.  Absolutely fantastic.  Dinner would not be complete without a wonderful Tiramisu!  Today I fast!!!

I have been to Marcellino at least 5 times in the last two years, the most recent visit in October.    The only thing that keeps me from giving Marcellino 5 stars is my spotty experience with the service.  On two occasions it took more than 30 minutes to get a check when we were ready; on another the owner/hostess was condescending.    The food has always been spectaular- 5 stars for the food.  The pasta and fillings are all freshly made.  Among our favorites: Paccatelli al Ragu di Salsiccia- this is one that my daughter has identified as the best Ragu in Phoenix; Gnocchi Sorrentina - the most dreamy-creamy gnocci dish; Lamb Chops al Balsamico- lamb can be sublime or awful- this was memorably sublime.  The salad with the pears and the Ortolana con Gamberi salad are also excellent.  The waiter's service was impeccible at my most recent visit~ attentive, knowledgable, professional and friendly.  I am pleased this was the case as I was hesitant to go because of my previous  experience with the staff.  On one occasion I brought one well-behaved child, on another brought two well-behaved children who enjoy dining.  It was the day I brought two children that I encountered the owner/hostess.  I arrived around 5pm (early- before the usual dinner crowd), and my children behaved perfectly (or I would not have taken them out).  The waiter was charming and attentive, but I felt that the owner/hostess was displeased that I brought children (who at the time were 9 and 10).  I paid full price for all entrees, didn't ask for special kid favors,  tip well and don't dawdle, and the kids were very quiet, so I was rather off-put that I would be be treated with veiled contempt.  I am sure that I will return at some point.  I woud advise the owners to consider tightening up their service, providing checks promptly, treating all guests with gracious respect, putting on the "make nice" smile when necessary.  Don't give a "bum's rush" to a customer with children who are behaving appropriately.
This is a nice restaurant but be careful what you order as it can be expensive. I've dined at some of the best restaurants in the world but don't think I've seen a $50 pasta dish before.

These people are absolutely rude! I've been sitting here for 20 minutes and all I've gotten are dirty looks. They're discriminatory and absolutely classless! The servers, Linda and Tanya are awful! The redeeming quality is Mickey! She was perfect! Seriously; will not be taking any friends to this rude discriminatory place.

Third time to this restaurant...first was as a visitor to the area, last two as a resident.  We ended up here last night on Valentine's Day after deciding to leave our previous restaurant due to the food being cold and service lacking, very glad we did.  As usual we sat at the bar and had our meal there, such a great environment and service is always personable and approachable.  You can't go wrong coming here to eat...the pasta is fresh and options are wonderful, they know what they are doing and you get that true old school, high end, yet relaxed Italian feel, thanks as always!

We heard about Marcellino from a hotel consierge and wondered if it would be as nice as it was described... punch line, it was and I recommend it for anyone who like great, authentic Italian cuisine - the food was terrific, the service was top notch, and Marcellino is a wonderful person. He doesn't pander to people; instead he understands the beauty of well-prepared food and hopes people will discover this for themselves

Very nice atmosphere.  Great bartender!  Food was overpriced for pasta. We sat on the patio and were surprised by the fact that a dog ran into the restaurant (not a service dog) and then the owner picked it up and was seated on the patio.  The owner of the dog processed to kiss the dog at the table tongue and all.  It was unsettling lucky we had already finished our meals.  Very odd that an upscale Scottsdale restaurant would allow this.  We would probably not go back

The FOODwas good! My friends ordered the Filet Mignon with median rare and Lamb Chop; they were awesome! Their homemade pasta special was impressive as well. We also had a bottle of white wine that the waiter introduced to us. The wine was very good just that i can't remember the name of it :P Also, we celebrated for one of the friends' birthday today! The restaurant was really thoughtful that they personalized our dessert for our birthday girl:) Wonderful SERVICE! Other than the delicious food and birthday cake, I love the service that Marcellino Ristoante had! Their waiter was really professional when introducing the food and recommending the wine. The AMBIANCE was really good for special occasion like birthday, anniversary or date =)

I took my wife and 2 year old here on a whim one day.  They were very nice to us and very happy to seat us with a kid, which in a nice restaurant is always great not to get a dirty look.  The waiter offered to do a half pasta for my little guy.  We loved the pasta.  I had one with braised beef that was so good.  My wife got a mushroom truffle pasta it was amazing.  My little guys gnocchi was a little fancy for him but he are them happily.  All the pasta is home made here.  My wife said it's her new favorite nice iris loan restaurant.   If you're looking for a date night this place is perfect.  Also I forgot to fill out the tip and sign and they came and found me!   I really appreciated them trying to find me instead if just adding whatever tip they wanted.   Great service.  Food came out quickly, and we were extremely impressed.   We're from NJ and NY so good Italian comes at a premium in AZ.   We'll be back!
Date nite, never been there and was pleasantly surprised...authentic Italian was so good and a bottle of wine, Paula and Justin were right on it.  I'd recommend it if you want good Italian food.

Brilliant - Server Scott was all over us! Fresh made pasta - ambiance perfect. Would go back again and again! Thank Chef, Scott and staff! I hope the translation is correct, That was Wonderful! Che è stato meraviglioso!!!

We had a private party scheduled for the 3-course chef tasting dinner.  The room was not ready, the menu was not as we discussed (there were meat dishes and we had a few vegetarians), the A/V equipment didn't work.   One of the guests also got a cup of coffee that tasted like chicken broth...the owner came back with some excuse for this, but the issue was not corrected.  We all had been looking forward to this dinner for some time now since we heard good things about this restaurant - this bad experience was enough for me not to return.

Maybe the only place in AZ that makes their own pasta? 5 stars by Arizona standards, 3 by Italy and other foodie joints across the globe - hence the compromise. Sorry AZ, you are on a relative scale.  I was bummed, because I was the only person in this restaurant for an hour and a half at 7 on a thursday night. Finally a good Italian joint in Phoenix and nobody shows-up. I hope this place survives.

This was the second time that I visited Marcellino and it did not disappoint. Went here with my fiancé and my dad and we all enjoyed the delicious food and amazing service from our waiter Leo and all of the staff. Started off with the mussels and burrata infused with black truffles which had really awesome flavor. Entrees included  lamb pappardelle, squid ink lobster/seafood pasta and a porcini mushroom pasta with lobster. All pastas had great texture and the meat/seafood was very tasty as well. Finished the night with cheesecake and another baked apple desert with a hazelnut ice cream on top. Overall, come for the food but stay for the great service! Great job Marcellino!

Ate here on vacation and had the most amazing experience. We were able to get a table right away outside and the patio has a great vibe and atmosphere. The food and wine was incredible. Gluten free friendly and wonderful staff. We will be back! Tony was awesome!

Amazing food. Fresh made pasta was awesome, will definitely return. Your hostess had a less then friendly greeting when we arrived to a less then half full restaurant with a "you don't have a reservation? Well let me see if there is anything we can put together for you" comment. Looking thought reviews it seems as though this is a familiar issue. I would have given a 5 star if the staff was more friendly and welcoming. Kitchen is outstanding!!!!

Was here last night and once I heard the chef was from Italy, I knew we were in good hands. Our server, Vita, was SO knowledgable about the food. When she was going through the pasta specials (pasta made in house and on display on a plate that Vita was showing us) we were absolutely shocked at the amount of detail of ingredients she was able to remember and sell us on. We chose the spinach ricotta ravioli that came with a light butter sauce and my boyfriend chose a pasta with portobello mushrooms and lobster, also came with a light sauce. The food was to die for!!! As for dessert, the tiramisu came out with a flaming sugar cube on the side, it was plated beautifully. I was expecting to be blown away but the tiramisu didn't have enough marscapone and way too much cocoa powder (totally my opinion-does NOT take away from the quality or deliciousness of the food). All in all-these people are doing a fantastic job. Will definitely be back!

The service was bad. The waiter was hard to find and we were 5 couples celebrating 3 anniversaries.  The waiter ignored our requests for bread 3 times. I even told him I would pay for it and he still ignored our request.  I had to get up and speak to the manager about it of which she assisted, but then the bread service stopped again after she stopped getting involved..  Not happy about paying a tip for such poor service..Will not go back...

Had feared that after moving to chic Scottsdale the food would suffer.  Thankfully that is not the case.  I love their pasta.  I don't even bother with the proteins, it is the pasta that is the star.  The crowd tends to skew a little older, (i.e. not the best place to that your fraternity brother), and even a first date might be a little off-putting.  In fact, you should probably confirm you like the person since the prices are a little steep.  But if you are willing to make the time and money commitment, there is no better place in town for wonderful fresh pasta that is toothsome and delicious.  The sauces lovingly envelope each bite and never overwhelms.  Bread is served and it is good, but do not fill up on bread no matter how much you like the eggplant spread that comes with it.  Come hungry, leave happy.  I'm still smiling.

That's right, it is woohoo as good as it gets!  This place is perfect for a celebration dinner with some special people.  After it was over, I wanted to bring everyone I love here to have a great experience - it's that freaking good!  The food was excellent.  The table shared some mozzarella & prosciutto and caprese.  I had the scialatielli alle vongole, the handmade pasta was out of this world delicious and top it off with amazing clams *drool*.  Oh, I can't forget the wine, the wine was actually the best part believe it or not, I can't recall all the names because like I said, it was a celebration dinner, but one stuck out "CUM LAUDE" haha, it still makes me giggle.  The service was also excellent, that coupled with the romantic decor and ambiance make this a 5 star dinning establishment, well, in my opinion anyway.
The food was good but don't go on a Thursday or Saturday if you want to converse with your guests, the music drowns out any conversation.
I was with a very large group that they handled very well.  Each most of us ordered one of the specials and all were great with freshly made pasta.  Excellent service.

AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID  Cold scallops followed after a very long wait by hardly cooked lukewarm pasta. Even though they took it off the bill they wanted to charge two bottles of wine even though we only had one.

This has to be one of my most favorite Italian restaurants in Scottsdale.   What I like about this place is their pastas are all handcraft daily.  My favorite pasta is their ribbon pasta. It is exquisite!  That being said my most favorite dish is their gnocchi.....   I have been to some of the finest Italian restaurants throughout the US, Europe and I frequent Italy often.  This is the best and I would suggest everyone to try it.

I'd heard about Marcellino for many years but never made it over there when they were in Phoenix.  My friends and I decided to check them out this last Saturday.  This is my third visit to the space that previously was occupied by Digestif, Tutto and now Marcellino.  Luckily for Fred Unger, he probably has a tenant here who will make it.    They changed the entrance and once I found my way in I was reminded what a great space this room is.  The exposed brick, dark colors and candlelight are very romantic.  Once seated we tasted a few wines and decided on a nice Barbera reasonably priced at $47 for the bottle.  Our appetizer was a bufalo mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto with tomato and basil.  It was a delicious start to the meal.  Since there were four of us we all decided to order something different so that we could all try each other's dish.  They show you the different pastas and explain the specials of the day.  Literally, all of the specials sounded great and it was tough to make a decision.  I ordered the porcini fettuccine which came with lobster.  Who doesn't like lobster but actually the pasta stole the show.  It was a real earthy, rich flavor that I loved.  The other dish that really stood out to me was the filet mignon and truffle tortelloni.  How can you go wrong with those ingredients?  To top off the evening they had live opera singers entertaining during dinner.  I've read people complain about the prices at Marcellino but I really don't agree.  Our bill was $207 plus tax and tip for four people.  For a topnotch meal with wine it was worth every penny to our group.

The food was under seasoned, over priced and not worth it. The food sounded way better than it tasted. The pasta was over cooked, lacked salt and pepper or anything unique. Almost tasted like a bottled sauce. And they were unwilling to modify the dishes

My Wonderful husband took me here for our Anniversary! I had never been to, nor heard of Marcellino's Resterante. I was thoroughly impressed with how impeccable and authentic the food was, but also how accommodating  and meaningful they made the entire experience.They made our special occasion into an unforgettable event!

If you like true Italian food, this is the place for you. Every day they serve a different selection of homemade pastas, which are incredible. Their gnocchi and paccatelli are personal favorites but each of their pastas is very good. Try this place and take your taste buds to Italy - you won't be sorry.

I can honestly say that Marcellino Ristorante in Old Town Scottsdale is one of my favorite restaurants! :)   My boyfriend & I went here on Saturday night and not only had an amazing dinner but another overall amazing experience!  Before dinner, we sat up at the bar where we had a few glasses of wine. Our bartender, Lou, took the time to get to know my name and made sure that my glass of wine was always full. It is evident that he truly cares about his customers and his restaurant.  For dinner, we started with the Imported Buffalo Mozzarella & Prosciutto appetizer. It was a generous portion and was wonderful. The ingredients are always fresh and it was the perfect way to start off our meal. (I'd say this is perfect for two people to share, unless you are really hungry!)  My boyfriend had the Santa Lucia for his main entree. It was delicious- And yes, he was generous enough to share. It is a "Black cuttle fish ink infused fettuccine sautéed with muscles, clams and calamari in a lightly spiced tomato sauce and topped with half of a 1 1/2 pound fresh Maine lobster." (I took this off their website because I decided my description could not do it justice.) It was an absolutely incredible dish- One not to be missed!  My dish was fairly similar to the Santa Lucia but not as big. Unfortunately the name is escaping me at the moment but it is a spicy tomato sauce with shrimp, fresh fish and calamari. It is phenomenal and worth every carb ;)  Our servers were both Rob & Johnny. They provided outstanding guest service! Oh and since it was a Saturday night, there was live entertainment. Some might consider the entertainer to be a "cheesy lounge singer" but I thought he was really good and put some romance (and laughs) in to our evening... Watching my boyfriend imitate and sing "At Last" to me was priceless.   Overall, if you are looking for an authentic Italian dinner with incredible service and owners that really care about their restaurant, I'd say come to Marcellino Ristorante! You'll not be disappointed.

Based on other reviews I expected to be wowed.  It is a nice restaurant but noisy and our pasta was good but not as flavorful as I hoped. Great place for a typical night out but not for a special occasion.

I started going here when they were on Northern and haven't looked back.  I'm not sure why they have a menu as the star of the show is the fresh made pasta.  They bring it by on a plate and tell you what is fresh for the day .  Porcini infused with lobster is hard to pass up but sometimes they have squid ink with seafood which is my favorite.   Service and dessert are middle of the road but I'm there for the pasta!

My husband and I stumbled across this place while walking around downtown on a Friday night. It was the ambiance of the restaurant that attracted us, romatic, dimly lit with an outdoor patio. When we walked up to the hostess, we told her we did not have a reservation, though would like to sit for dinner. She was extremely rude, annoyed, and walked away. I actually looked at my husband and started to leave the restaurant, until the waiter nearby caught what happened and seated us on the patio.   The food was amazing-- the gnocchi was so soft and tender, best ever. My husband ordered some special mushroom infused pasta.. It was also delicious. I would definitely return, next time making sure I have a reservation I guess.

How can I not give Marcellino five stars?  The food was fantastic - as was the experience.  We'd been hearing about Marcellino Ristorante for awhile but it wasn't until we were looking for a place to celebrate Mother's Day that we thought to check it out.  From the moment I called to make a reservation, we received the friendliest service ever!  I was told that they could take our group at 6:45 and that they'd have a live Opera Singer (specifically a Tenor) in house that night performing - what a treat!  Well - that's what I figured when they told me that.  (None of us were opera fans before and we still are not opera fans, but it did add to the experience!)  We were seated right away and Scott was our server.  He was attentive and patient with us, even when Jared had him repeat the specials several times.  Their homemade pasta specials looked incredible, but I stayed away... Instead, I enjoyed the Insalata Ortolana, a few bites of the Canestina Polenta (if you like polenta and you like mushrooms, get this - it's incredible), and I shared the Gamberi Affogtai entree with my mother-in-law-to-be.  We requested extra veggies instead of mashed potatoes and not only did they oblige, but the broccoli, cabbage, and asparagus we received were delicious!  The shrimp were magnificent as well - juicy and tender!  Oh - I have to also admit to having some of the 'special sauce' they serve with the bread basket... it is tangy and wonderful - if you go, you must try that too.  It's made with eggplant, olive oil, and red pepper I believe... yum!  Jared and his sister had a Caprese Salad (a bit overpriced at $12.95), the Paccatelli al Ragu (a bolognese pasta dish I believe), the Scaloppine al Gorganzola (a veal dish that he enjoyed but serving size was not as big as he'd wished for).  We finished off the meal with an Apple Galetta served with hazelnut gelato and a Panna Cotta (similar to flan).  While I had just a small taste of the apple one, I can report that it was delicious... and since Jared and his mom finished off the panna cotta, i'll assume it was not so bad either.  All of the above plus a pellegrino, a coffee, and a cappuccino for $159.85 before tip.  Note - no alcohol.  So, yes, we wish it was more affordable - but we'll be back without a doubt!
Best pasta I have ever had. Don't go there if you're looking for a two-pound chicken parm or endless breadticks.

Service was amazing! When making our reservation, we mentioned it was our early V Day date so when we arrived, our waiter had picked us a great table and served us complimentary Prosseco. Gnocchi was the best we ever had! Wine was delicious! Dessert was ok. Prices are high but the pasta is homemade and delicious and it was worth it!  The staff also had great knowledge of the emenu and made great suggestions! The atmosphere is romantic and classy!  We recommend having dinner here!!!!
Very welcoming - good Italian food and atmosphere.  This is a place we will go back to!

EXCELLENT FOOD, EXCELLENT AMBIENCE, EXCELLENT SERVICE. As vegitarian who is 100% Italian, it's hard to find REAL Italian food with fresh outrageous ingredients. Well I found it here! It was obviously Marcellino -culinary artist as he is- has his finger on everything. I thought he must have studied the craft in Italy.  Went with my boyfriend for our anniversary and we ate on the lovely patio. I had the hand made Strozzaprette e Broccoli rabe. It was OUTSTANDING (never thought I would find Broccoli rabe in the valley!   We had such a lovely experience. This will definitely be our go-to for special occasions.
We had a large group of 18 for dinner Saturday night. Marcellino would personally come out from the kitchen after every course and

Hands down the best Italian food in Arizona.  And to boot, the waiters speak intelligently about the food and are polite.    The only reason this isn't getting a 5 start rating is because their isn't much value in the meal.  I understand that the intent or spirit of the restaurant isn't centered on value, but I the portions of the food are not congruent with the pricing.

The BF and I stopped here for lunch one day during the week.  There was only one other table there...and with so many of the other places nearby really busy, we were a little skeptical.  We were not disappointed!  The service was wonderful, the food was wonderful, the bread and dipping sauce they bring out is wonderful!  I think the reason it was so empty is because it is a bit pricy....for lunch.  We loved it though.  I look forward to going back!

Short of making a trip to Italy, and very much like that trip, I did not want to leave. I had plans to eat at another place but for some reason was drawn to this gem. Most likely Because of the picture of the beautiful husband and wife on their website, I knew this would be the right choice.  Seated promptly I began asking questions about the wine, specifically the Amarone. Turns out the owner worked at Amorone in Nyc, a place where I have so many fond memories. As I looked around the restaurant I could see the similarities but taken far beyond with their own passion for life.  Pasta waits for no one! Any they have it, handmade and as you can see from my pictures, fantastic!  To start I had the carpaccio di manzo. The same as I used to eat at NYC but served with a greater passion. Thinly sliced, raw tenderloin blankets arugola topped with sliced fresh mushrooms, perfectly shaved Parmigiano and herbed lemon dressing to play games with your taste buds.  Before I left the owner told me the story of his wedding night in NYC, which is the picture he and I stand next to. I used to say, ONLY IN NEW YORK---and now ONLY NOW  in SCOTTSDALE.  Piano Piano

I've been looking for that place in Scottsdale that is like cheers where everybody knows your name and the food is phenomenal.   I found it this trip at Marcellinos.  I dined here two nights in a row and had the best food and entertainment experience that I've had in Scottsdale. I had a chicken dish,  a seafood dish, and both experiences were amazing.I will be back every trip to Scottsdale that I make!! If you haven't been here you need to go.

If you're looking for a romantic restaurant in the heart of old town Scottsdale, Marcellino's is it. The ambiance for dinner is intimate, dim lighting, the owners are there making sure you're happy, and on weekends there's live music, that's not too loud but adds a romantic backdrop to your night with love songs you'll recognize. Now, the food, hold on to your hats, everything is homemade, overseen by Marcellino himself! I had the beef filet ravioli, it will go down as one of my favorite pasta dishes or dinners for that matter, ever! I spent Valentine's Day there with Joe, it was beautiful. We recently went there with a group of good friends, we let the Italian wine flow, and laughed the night away.

as someone who is extremely picky about italian food, i have to give marcellino's high marks for some of the best pasta and tiramisu i've ever had! we ordered the off menu ravioli and tortellini dishes which were delicious and they were kind enough to let us split the entrees. the tiramisu was fantastic,, we almost ordered a second one! the only minor criticism we had was the service was a little slow we waited quite awhile for our bread, but other than that the beautiful patio and excellent food gave us an authentic italian experience

I was so disappointed by the food.  Very bland. .. no flavor.   I had the pork medallions and not only were they overcooked,  but almost not edible...no spices.  My husband had the seafood pasta.. again,  horrid with no flavor. . He had to add salt and a lot of cheese just to get it down.  Bread seemed old and the spread they served with it was also tasteless...we asked for butter and it tasted funny... something was just not right.   Upside was the wine. . Very good.   Needless to say we won't be back.

I had the privilege of dining at this restaurant because I was given a gift certificate. The dollar amount was quite high so I knew this will be a "fine dining" experience - one I probably would not rather pay for. I reviewed the menu and didn't see that the prices were that bad - so I invited my future in laws and future husband. When we got there, the restaurant was cozy and intimate. Right away, the employees were really nice. They asked us if we have ever dined before and we told them "no". They gave us complimentary bread and a small meat and cheese platter.   The waiter went over the specials and also brought over a pasta display - these were not on the menu and he had to verbally tell us about each - of which the prices were way more than the pasta dishes on the menu. I couldn't resist despite the prices - maybe it was his voice, the way he detailed the dishes, and the fact there was a display in front of us that made me forget the menu all together and order off of his verbal recommendations: my fubby and I shared the Buffalo Mozzarella for an appetizer, the Porcini Fettucini for an entree and I got the Bellinitini for my drink.  Everything was incredible - even the bread and I normally don't eat bread! When we got the check - for four of us, it was a little less than $200 ($50/person). Thank god for the gift certificate to help pay the bill and the fact that we shared!   Overall, atmosphere = 5, food = 5, service = 5, price = 2. It would be a great place to visit for a special occasion.

Had been wanting to try Marcellino's for awhile, but the last time we tried, it was closed as the owners were away in Italy.  Finally got around to a very overdue visit tonight.  Dinner was excellent. Started with a special app, buffalo mozzarella wrapped in proscuito served with roasted peppers, fresh basil and fresh tomatoes.  It was perfect.  The mozzarella tasted home-made.  Tried the mushroom linguine and red lingunie for entrees.  All of the pastas are made by hand in the restuarant.  Both dishes were very good.   Rounded out the perfect meal with a perfect slice of tiramisu.  They also gave a number of service items including, bruschetta with fresh tomatoes and basil before the app, and a shot of homemade limoncello with biscotti after desert.  With wine, it was about $65 pp which was reasonable.

The food here is absolutely delicious.  We came for Mother's Day and my family could not of picked a better place to celebrate.  The food and service was awesome all around.  Marcellino Ristorante is definitely a special occasion place it is expensive but worth every penny.  Nice touch at the end when they gave all mom's a free homemade dessert.

If you're looking for a good Italian place for a fancy night out or a nice dinner date, this is the place to go! Came here with my husband the day before the Phoenix marathon for some "carb-loading," & boy I'm glad we did!! We made reservations for Friday night, which good thing we did because the place was packed! The service was great; our food came out hot and fresh, our water glasses were never more than half empty, and the server was very attentive & explained the menu & specials very well. We got fettuccine pasta with asparagus, as well as the steak ravioli and truffle pasta. I don't remember the exact names of everything, but it was all VERY good. I also ordered the "Bellini-tini" cocktail, and the caprese appetizer. The chef himself makes everything from scratch, and you can definitely tell from the taste and freshness of the food! Overall, it was a little on the expensive side, but very well worth it!

I think Marcellino's will get a second chance for a special occasion.  I visited the restaurant based on seeing it on Check Please Arizona.  The food is obviously made fresh and was excellent but I felt a little overpriced based on other excellent restaurants in the area.  Although the atmosphere was romantic, I had a hard time reading the menu and the bill using just the votive candle on the table.  There has to be a better way!

Definitely the best Italian cuisine in the valley by far.  They're specialty handmade pasta is like nothing you've ever experienced before. To top it off Marcellino has perfected the chocolate cake. The ambiance, the food, the service it's all amazing. Highly recommend

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday earlier today. I hadn't heard of it but I saw something about it on yelp earlier that morning and decided to try it. The atmosphere was beautiful and the patio was adorable so we decided to sit outside. It wasn't busy at all and I probably didn't need a reservation for a Monday night. We ordered the scallops for an appetizer. I was shocked when the waiter brought it out because there was only 3 and the price was about $19. Honestly they were so rich and buttery you only need about two to feel satisfied. They were amazing!!! I got the gnocchi with red sauce and they were to die for. They were so rich and had little blobs of melted mozzarella all over. All their pasta is housemaid and fresh. My boyfriend got a pasta with shrimp and mushroom (can't remember the names because they were all Italian and super fancy) and he loved it. It came with a ton of shrimp which I was also surprised by! Overall I loved it and can't wait to return. Paola was our server and she is from Italy. She truly gave us a great experience especially by surprising us with flaming tiramisu at the end for his birthday. I hate tiramisu but it was honestly so creamy and delicious that I can't stop thinking about it! It was about $74 for the two of us but 100% worth it.

Great local Italian in old town Scottsdale. Always crowded, always fun. We were there March 10th during Giants spring training. Beautiful weather and lovely location. The food-- home made pasta specials each night in addition to the regular menu standbys-- actually it's a quite large menu loaded with options. Wife and I had carpaccio, burrata salad, and a wonderful pasta special. By the way, check the prices before you order-- our pasta special was $46 each. It was excellent nevertheless. Service very good even though they are barraged with a continuous stream of tourists. This is a fun place-- enjoy.

ok...so we had dinner here tonight based on all the fabulous reviews on this site. I have to wonder what all the posters were thinking. I'm sure these are all people who feel if something is expensive and overpriced, then that translates to exceptional.  First off, the service was almost non existent and the most I can say is that everyone we encountered from the hostess to the waiter who took our order, is that they were very cold and almost arrogant - the farthest thing from friendly service.  We ordered mussels in the red sauce as an appetizer. Very ordinary and the sauce had hardly any taste at all. Some of the mussels were actually empty shells.  Next we ordered the green salad with balsamic vinagerette. Really now, $10 for what amounted to  bag salad greens - with nothing else - accompanied with what i assume plain bottled dressing.  Our entrees weren't bad, but not great either - again, just ordinary. All in all, the entire meal was so mediocre, we didn't even want to mess with ordering dessert.  The "ambiance" was nothing to write home about..I really have to scratch my head at all the 4 and 5 star reviews.   Not terrible...just way overpriced for what it is...For their prices, I expected to have a phenomenal meal.

Fabulous Italian food. The special house made pastas are so good. I have the sun dried tomato pasta with shrimp and scallops. Slightly spicy sauce was delicious.   They have a short but well diverse wine list. The Italian wines are featured and delicious. There are some lower priced wines along with some extremely expensive choices.   The service is always top notch and the place has a very authentic Italian reel to it.

Update:  I appreciate the response, but the responder needs to do a little more research and cite their sources when claiming that food poisoning can only occur within a four hour window. Here is a helpful article that sheds light on the actual incubation times for food borne illness, which can definitely be caused by improper hygiene when preparing a salad and can take as long as 48 hours to appear:  http://www.buzzle.com/articles/incubation-period-for-food-poisoning.html

Great atmosphere and very good service. The food is pretty average. Perhaps we are spoiled by our local Italian Restaurant, but the food is way over priced for the quality. The desserts are really nice. Gelato, Apple pastry, or the sorbet are ver nice. Probably won't go back next time we are in town since there are soooo many choices in the area.

Standard and no charm. Wine list is OK.  I get that the options in this neighborhood in Scottsdale are all going to be around the same: new construction, manufactured and heavily AC-ed Disney World restaurants,but I wish I opted for something a little less contrived. While our bus boy was very nice, our server seemed like he had better places to be every time he came over.  Ordered the gnocchi, which was fine but boring.

This is not your traditional Italian American restaurant.  You're not going to get an endless bowl of pasta, bread sticks or a basic marinara sauce. What you will get is fresh home made pasta, ethereal sauces, and a waitstaff that knows the menu.    After several visits and a boat load of money (this place ain't cheap), I'm a fan.  Today, we were served by Vita. I have rarely met a waitress that was more knowledeagble about the menu or the wine list.  My wife ordered the zuppe de pesce.  Let's just say that the bowl was empty and I could'nt get a piece of bread in there. It was off the charts.  I ordered the "orange' pasta with shrimp and a light tomato sauce.  I couldn't get it into my mouth fast enough. The rest of our group was equally pleased.  So, why not five stars. This is totally stupid but at this price point, little things should be perfect.  Bread was good but over cooked. And here is my big (but so little that I'm embarrassed) butter with bread should have been softened to room temperature.  Don't miss this place.  Pasta is amazing, service is great.  Just serve fresher bread and softer butter.

If you want to impress a date, take them to Marcellino's.  My first visit there was with a date, and I was definitely impressed.   Your dining experience there will be private, personal and in a lovely atmosphere.  As a diner, you will feel like everything is especially for you.... and it is. Marcellino makes sure that your meal is worth savoring and that you will appreciate your evening enough to return.

I agree with all the enthusiasts here.  The handmade PASTAS are AWESOME!!  So delish!!!  Too bad I live in LA!  I was driving through Phoenix and I'm so glad I stopped by!  I would definitely make another visit when I'm in Phoenix.

Visited the restaurant for our club's holiday lunch yesterday with about 20 people. Pleasing a group is always hard; this time every single guest had praise for the restaurant from food to service. Most ordered from the special lunch menu which offered a handful of different selections from starters to main course, including a glass of wine for $24 total. Not bad. I enjoyed the organic green salad, the gnocchi with tomato and mozzarella, and added the chocolate mousse. No complaints about the food. Minor complaint would be that the breadbasket delivered to our table had 4 small slices of hard baguette, not enough the serve our section of the table. I'm sure they would have delivered more if asked. Also another guest ordered chocolate mousse and his was twice the size of mine, delivered in an ice cream glass filled to the brim with mousse and whipped cream. Mine came in a small martini glass, so I felt a little annoyed by the rather large discrepancy between the desserts. Overall A+ experience with the restaurant letting us hang out for 3+ hours having lunch and our gift exchange.

Off the chart amazing!!! We went here for my birthday and it was literally the best Italian restaurant I have ever eaten at ( and I've eaten at my share in Italy). The ambiance was a soothing glow of gentle lighting and rustic brickwork, with Italian opera piped in. The food was a perfectly prepared collection of hand-made pastas in exotic flavors - cheese infused, squid ink colored, and wonderfully sauced. The desert was a just-right tiramisu - capping a delectable meal. Yes, it's a bit pricey - but TOTALLY worth it for special occasion food.  Oh - and come on Saturday evenings to get serenaded by live opera singers!
My favorite Italian restaurant in Old Town hands down. Homemade pasta here is the best and they have a variety of options.
The ambience here is wonderful and the food is pretty good, but it is extremely expensive for what you're getting.

Had a lovely NYE dinner here with family. Staff was courteous and professional. Dirty martini was great and decent size. Had the squid ink pasta which was okay. Live music was pleasant and not too loud.
As always.  Great service.  Fantastic food.  Great weather for seating in the outside patio and having an early dinner as the sun sets.  A definite favorite Scottsdale restaurant.

Wow good here. Private party soon here, so I have been given a time window for dinner. No problem. White Moscato now, Italian, is excellent. Sparkling water also. Have asked for pasta of sausage, tomatoes in marinara. Nice setting here and I'm actually outside seating area which is very nice. And can almost touch my parked bicycle!! $25 for 3 scallops was out of line high...anywhere. But everything was quite excellent and $115. Also quite enough!!

Visited for Restaurant Week and was disappointed. Portions were very small for the prix fix $44.00. The select menu was mainly pasta. Salad of field greens was tasteless. I had the salmon which was very small and bland. Not sure how an Italian restaurant has only one veal dish. The atmosphere is nice with both inside and out dining.

YES YES AND YES. My husband and I ate here as a "last hurrah" dinner for our incredible vacation. We came on a Sunday evening and were able to get in for a 6:00 reservation outside. Like other Yelpers suggested, the specialty pastas and where it's at - don't even bother looking at the regular menu.  Our server was incredibly knowledgeable. We asked her suggestion for a full-bodied red wine that wasn't too dry. She had one in mind she said wouldn't break the bank (turned out to be $17/glass - one of the lowest on the price scale) and to our surprise, she delivered perfectly and we both really enjoyed it.  My husband got the pasta with cheese and pepper made as part of the dough, which came with I believe the crisped proscuitto, while I went for the homemade sausage and truffle dish. We were truly BLOWN AWAY and how good our dishes were. We both ate the very last bites and still managed to share some tiramisu. This place is amazing and while probably as expensive as a dinner we'd go ($150 before tip), there were some other places we considered with multiple courses and costs twice the price (though still $$$ on Yelp). We would happily do this over again and would recommend to anyone looking for a low-key, romantic evening with incredible eats.

What an amazing experience. Like stepping into Italy. The food is like nothing I have had before, fresh, truly beautiful presentation and a treat for your taste buds!  Not only amazing cuisine but the restaurant family that is there makes it as though you are a guest in their home. You will be hooked and a frequent guest!!

Wonderful food, impeccable service, and the ambiance is terrific. We have visited twice now and each time have walked away shaking our heads- the first time it was because- "Why haven't we tried this place before?" And the second time- "We didn't think they could top that first visit but they sure did!!" Both times we've visited, we ordered from their handmade pasta specials. Totally worth it!! We also had the buffalo mozzarella appetizer- so fresh and delicious. To cap off our wonderful evenings there, we've indulged in the chocolate espresso dessert- absolutely decadent; and the tiramisu- very yummy. Chef Marcellino, Sima and their staff are the best.

Incredible food and ambiance! The staff definitely needs some polishing to match everything else in this restaurant, but otherwise this is an outstanding place. If you want a romantic setting with authentic Italian food, lovely wines and incredible desserts, look no further.

Was recommended this restaurant as it has been around for some years and decided to have dinner with friends there. The environment is lovely. Clearly a classy place and has nice decor. There was a band playing (which was too loud) and we found it difficult to have conversation at a normal volume. We did have to speak quite loudly throughout dinner to hear each other.  The food was good although my wife did not enjoy her meal at all. Was a little cold and tasteless. I had the osso bucco which was very good. The others had the same and the lamb ragout, which they bother loved also. Wine list is pure Italy which is nice and the desserts were good, but over priced for the size of the servings. Overall, a reasonable dining experience.

I have always heard great things about Marcellino's so I went to lunch there today with my friend. Her salad was red leaf lettuce(NOTHING else)...the salad dressing was good. Her pasta(with sausage) was about as good as a can of Chef Boyardee. My grilled shrimp salad had 4 nicely grilled shrimp....and once again boring red leaf lettuce($18.95). The server was very nice.  Would I go back...no thank you...bitterly disappointed

The atmosphere was great here, clean bathrooms, beautiful patio and decorated cozily. The waiter was very knowledgeable about the food and courses along with the wine selection. The food was good but for the price I don't think it was worth it. This is a good spot for a first date if you want to impress her you have some money. I unfortunately didn't try the pasta but it is all handmade (I misunderstood the waiter and got what he recommended which was a light white fish, with mashed potatoes, zucchini and carrots) it was good but I wish I would have gotten some pasta just to try it. I also got the Insalata Tre Colori which was a Radicchio, endive and arugola with lemon dressing. The salad was okay, lacked a lot of flavor. It tasted slightly dirty but was decent (I probably wouldn't get that salad again). The wine selection is great. The one bus lady had a huge attitude and was rude (maybe she was having a bad day). I would try this place just one more time but go for the pasta this time.

Very impressed with the pasta special. Big portions and quality food.  The live music was a perfect volume and waiters were very attentive.  The only complaint that I have is the mediocre seating.   I would recommend this to anyone craving Italian food.

I am part Italian...so my husband and I have a VERY difficult time finding a restaurant that meets my expectations. So far this is the only one I will go back to. I was impressed that you could order a $48 pasta dish...but my husband and I ordered off the regular menu (not the specials). The chef does know his pasta and sauce! I ordered the Mare Y Monte (Land and Sea) pasta with shrimp. It had the quality ingredients, and no complaints on using FRESH tomato...this is what pasta sauce should be made with. My husband had clams and pasta....the pasta was Lovely!  Yes there was opera inside (beautiful), we chose to sit on the patio (a tad bit noisy because of street traffic).  The food and patrons may not be in my tax bracket....but I am willing to try it again (once I save up my change!)
Popped in for an early evening happy hour - fantastic fresh food and a truly authentic Italian experience! The patio is simply beautiful, I didn't want to leave!

Been back to Marcellino's many times, every time excellent. My wife and I just celebrated our anniversary this past December first 2015 and had the extreme pleasure of having dinner at Marcellino's and to our surprise his very beautiful wife Sima was performing for the first time with her trio. All we can state is the food the service and the music what a wonderful  evening it was.

I only wish that Yelp allowed you to give you negative stars after eating at this dreadful restaurant. It is, by far, the worst Italian restaurant I've ever eaten at. Don't go here unless you like paying a ridiculous amount of money for a ridiculously small amount of bad food. And to top it off, the only thing that will match your tasteless food will be the horrible service you get.   The Food   Simply put, it's terrible. We're an Italian family that has eaten great Italian food from coast to coast and this is, by far, the worst we've ever had. All told, we had one appetizer and three different entrees and it was all tasteless. Virtually no flavor at all. Don't be fooled by something sounding good in the description on the menu if you are unfortunate enough to go here because it probably won't taste anything like it sounds. In fact, it may not have any taste at all. Our food was bland and not cooked properly. The chicken and steak were rubbery, the pasta undercooked and the shellfish chewy. The only good thing about the food is that the portions are so pathetically small that you won't have to suffer through eating it for too long and you will have plenty of room left in your stomach to go eat at a real restaurant after you leave here if you haven't maxed your credit card paying the bill. BTW, if you want to pay $15 for a piece of chocolate espresso cake about the size of a small cupcake this is the place for you.    The Service   Even worse than the food, if that is possible. We had to basically demand some bread because we were extremely hungry and we were told that they usually don't bring bread until after you order. We had to tell them to bring the bread three times and when they did there was no butter. That took another five minutes and it was hard as a rock when it showed up. Don't get too excited though....the bread is a half step up from Wonder Bread straight out of the supermarket. OK, that's not fair...Wonder Bread has more flavor. They pressure you to order, try to get the plates off the table as soon as you put your fork down and clearly want to get you in and out of there as fast as possible so the next poor sap can get your table and get robbed without a gun for a little portion of terrible food.   But Wait, There's More...CHECK YOUR CHECK!  As if overpaying for tiny portions of the crappiest, most tasteless Italian food you've ever eaten with horrendous service isn't enough, here comes the icing on the cake. They have the unmitigated gall to AUTOMATICALLY ADD A 20% GRATUITY TO YOUR BILL! And we were only 4 people, not a large party where this is sometimes done. It is straight up offensive but it might explain why the service is so bad because they know they are slamming you with a 20% gratuity so they probably couldn't care less. If you complain to them about it they will remove the forced gratuity which is somewhat like a pickpocket giving you back your wallet when you catch them counting your money.   Let me make this easy. DO NOT EAT AT THIS AWFUL EXCUSE FOR A RESTAURANT. But, if you have a bitter enemy that you absolutely despise and need to get some kind of revenge on, tell them to eat at this horrific establishment and sleep soundly knowing that you have gotten the last laugh.

While in Scottsdale AZ i was with a group of 8 and this restaurant was recommended by one of the people I was with who told us that he had dined here once before and that it was excellent.  The restaurant had a great low light vibe to it and the inside was clean and neat.  We were seated and served promptly.  So I look at the menu and could not help but to form my first impression that this was going to be one of "those restaurants" that has this fancy, cursive, old school-script written menus with a bunch of words on the menu that I did not know how to pronounce.  This silly, cursive, fancy print is pretty annoying and this type of restaurant usually results in the food winding up being average at best.  This is my actual experience anytime I have seen a menu like this.  Anyways this was not the case.  I actually struggled a bit to find an entree on the menu that I really desired.  nothing really stood out quite frankly on the regular menu.  Our server came around and then took our appetizer order.  We went light and ordered the mozzarella and tomato app and fried polenta.  Both were excellent, but both dishes are also kind of tough to screw up especially for a finer dining restaurant, right?  When the server came back after we devoured our apps, she reeled off 6 homemade pasta specials that were not on the menu.  Two of which caught my ear immediately.  So apparently this restaurant makes a bunch of different kinds of handmade, and flavor infused pastas each day along with a certain sauce to go along with it.  I recall one of the dishes being a butternut ravioli, and another being a sheet type of pasta with a Gorgonzola cheese sauce and chicken.  (A friend of mine sitting near me got this dish and it was awesome).  I went for the papardelle with a red lamb ragu.  It was epic to say the least.    Everybody at my table told me that they truly enjoyed their meals and unfortunately so much that we were too full to try any dessert.  Being from the east coast I did not expect much at all from an Italian restaurant in Arizona, I seriously didn't.  I did not mention the service but it was also very good.  Everything was flawless.  This place would be an absolute hit not only on the east coast but anywhere you put it in the US.  I will definitely be back here the next time I visit Scottsdale AZ. Great job.

Marcellino's was an amazing romantic dinner experience.  I had their fresh pasta w/mushroom truffles and lobster.  The combination was amazing.  I also had the white wine that's made by a friend in Italy.  It was tantalizing and really lingered on my pallet.  The homemade tiramisu was a blissful ending to dinner.  The staff is attentive and very helpful.

I came here for a late lunch and ordered the lunch special (you can replace the wine with an additional appetizer).  The highlight of the meal was definitely the mussels in white wine appetizer.  The mussels were extremely fresh and tender, and the broth they were cooked it was so delicious that my entire family kept dipping the bread into my bowl.  The pastas are handmade and good.  Many of them have interesting additions (sun dried tomatoes, sweet potatoes), etc.

Although a bit on the pricey side, the creativity of this chef comes out in the food and drinks. I had some lamb dish that was delectable, tender and in just the right amount. My date has the filet Mignon pasta dish and it too was very good. The service was spot on as well.  Very classy. There was live music in the Sinatra style playing through the evening.   I had a mule drink that was very good.  My dates drink was great as well.   I didn't much care for where they sat us - next to the band - and that was the only turn-off particularly since they made it seem like we needed reservations, which clearly we didn't as the place was half empty on a Saturday night - off season of course.   But I forgave them and I had a wonderful date experience, thanks in part to them.

Went there for restaurant week with my girl friends.  We all pretty disappointed.  Foods were not tasty for that price.  Server had no personality and not smile once.  He rushed my friend to order when obviously he was told they were still waiting for me to get there.   Busser was nice and offered to take a picture for us.  Wish I could have tipped him instead.   Overall this place is overrated.

We were entertaining out of town guests. I made an Opentable 7:45 Thursday night reservations for a party of 4. When we arrived, we were greeted and seated right away. The atmosphere was very nice, with live music, we were seated more towards the entrance of the restaurant so the music did not drown our our conversation. Our server introduced himself and it was smooth sailing for the rest of the evening.  Our guest ordered a bottle of wine to share and my friend and I ordered cocktail while reviewing the menu. We started off with Beef Carpaccio. Pear Salad and Shrimp with Feta appetizers. Entrees were the Mussels in Spiced Tomato Sauce, Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli, Veal Scaloppine with Gorgonzola and Gnocchi. We ended the night with Cappuccinos.  All the food was delicious and our server excellent as he was so patient in letting us catch up with conversation while still be attentive, so patient that we managed to be the last table of customers in the restaurant and were not asked to leave because of closing.  Atmosphere: very nice, Service: excellent, Food: very good, and thank you for letting close the restaurant... most enjoyable night.

We went for our 5 year wedding anniversary. We had been several times before and the food was memorable. This evening it was nothing like our previous experience. The dishes were all lacking flavor. I ordered the ravioli which I was so looking forward to and I was extremely disappointed. It was lacking flavor and was no where near the tasty dish I remembered from before. We also ordered the clam and muddle appetizer which tasted like rubber doused in water. We left spending $150 and wishing we went to Hillstone or another restaurant for our special evening out.

They say Phoenix's greatest restaurants are found in strip malls and this is a prime example.  A good friend took me here on a Monday night and we were greeted by the Italian husband and wife owners and shown all the fresh hand-made pasta specials of the evening.  I chose the crimini infused pasta with crimini mushrooms, truffle oil and....magic!  Caprese salad is the precursor to any italian meal and they have it perfected- adding roasted peppers.  The suggested wine was incredible and the pasta left me speechless!  It tasted just like the night in Rome when my new friend Fiorella took me on her vespa to the "restaurant where typical italians eat".  I savored each bite at Marcellino just as I did in Rome!  It is a bit pricey, but worth every cent!  I can't wait to go back!  P.S. I tried to incorporate the genius term "American Bastardization" into my yelp like Anne W, but couldn't get it to fit.  The analogy Marcellino:Rome as Olive Garden:American Bastardization of Rome is my best attempt.

We sat at the Chef's table. He was very pleasant. Wines served ranged from $ 9 to  $ 30 at best [ as per Vivino] with ratings less of 2 to 3 stars. Plates served were mediocre. We ( couple) paid around $500.00 with tip. Would not recommend to a friend.

Great atmosphere, great service (our waiter was most entertaining), impressive wine selection, phenomenal food. Deciding to take advantage of the cooler weather, we enjoyed our meal on the quaint patio. I had the seafood special with squid ink pasta, mussels, clams, calamari and a 3/4 lb. lobster in a spicy marinara sauce. It was easily one of the most enjoyable Italian dishes I've tried yet (and I consider myself to be quite the Italian cuisine connoisseur). I will definitely be back to enjoy this neighborhood gem situated on the Waterfront in the heart of Old Town Scottsdale.
Excellent Food. Our 2nd time here. Celebrated my  daughters 21st Birthday.  Excellent homemade pasta.

Everything here was amazing. The jumbo shrimp with feta cheese appetizer was delicious and the shrimp was perfectly cooked. The chefs special portofino was with shrimp and scallops. The dish did not taste "fishy" and the sauce was a little spicy. My girlfriend got the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce and it was phenomenal. The best part of the whole meal was the tiramisu at the end. The home made whipped cream even came out on fire! Highly recommend.

Best. Italian. Cuisine.!!! Day fresh pasta, rustic yet refined. The husband wife team is the charm of this fantastic restaurant and the kicker is the amazing food. I have eaten here maybe 50 times maybe more and it is ALWAYS perfection! Top notch staff, clean and beautiful decor obviously these folks are pros long live Marcelino's!

Overrated period! Wow. Looks like we set a low bar for itialian food in az. Group of 8 and most of the dishes were just ok. Everyone had a different meal. The raw lamb chops didnt sit well either. Zuppa de pesca was sub par. Portions of seafood in dishes sub par. Server also was not pleasant either.    The plus side is great atmosphere great location great music. Food i can find better on anycorner.  is this place still in business must be all the resorts recommending a place they never stepped   foot in for a kickback.

I had read the reviews on Yelp of Marcellino's, and so was eager to try it, so I scheduled a lunch meeting there today.  Given the glowing reviews, I will probably give it one more chance at dinner sometime, but it was definitely a let down.  I had a six top, and we were six of the 8 people in the entire place for lunch.    Service was good, with frequent refills, and they left us plenty of time to get to business before taking our orders.  There was an alright red pepper spread for the bread, although olive oil and balsamic would have been a welcome addition.  Most of the table got either grilled chicken or salmon, which came with a small green salad: portions were very small for mid teens to lower 20s per entree for lunch.  I and another person got the shrimp and scallops in a lightly spiced red sauce with linguine dish.  There were plenty of shrimp, but they were small and extremely overcooked: they reminded me of shrimp that have been left in a ceviche for too long.  The scallops were cut into very small pieces, and were also overcooked, although not as badly as the shrimp were.  The sauce was made with fresh tomatoes, which were left in large chunks, and I have to say I would have very much preferred the use of canned San Marzano tomatoes instead: it was mild, with little body to it.  The pasta was not badly done, but seemed a bit soft for my taste in pasta.  Overall, very disappointing, but so many good experiences can't be wrong, can they?
Went with my wife for just dessert. Had one of the best tiramisu. Live music was great. Bit pricey.

Came here as a surprise to my bf on his birthday. They exceeded every request I made and gave us the most romantic table on the patio. The chef's wife came by to wish him a happy birthday. We even received multiple complementary courses (an appetizer, dessert, and drink). Service was outstanding-definitely no rush from staff. We opted for two of their off-menu homemade pasta dishes. We ate: scallop pesto appetizer (scallops were a bit small for price but sauce was yummy to dip their bread in). We also ordered the homemade filet, vegetable, cheese tortellini (my favorite) and a spicy sundried tomato pasta with shrimp and scallop). They are expensive but well worth it. Our waiter even offered to split the plates and course them out since we wanted to share- a very classy offering that allowed us to each get to try both pastas w/o having to share a plate and take our time through the meal since they were coursed out for us. It was one of our best and favorite dining experience-will be back!

A go to every time I'm in Scottsdale. Go for the homemade pastas that are made fresh daily with different options each time I visit. This isn't the place to order the salmon, while I'm sure its delicious. I absolutely love the lamb ragu with pappardelle and would every single visit. I recently ventured away from the ragu (thanks a lot Lent) and had the tagliolini with shrimp. It was fantastic. All portions are good size and I'd expect to have some left over.   Great spot to sit outside in March with some great wine (awesome wine list) and pasta. if you want a great night of Italian in Scottsdale this is your place.

Nice time overall.  Food was very good, and waiter was informative and nice.
