We had an early reservation and asked to sit outside (in the front) but was told those tables were reserved -- and then the two I had my eye on remained empty our entire meal.  Oh well.  We enjoyed the restaurant, and would likely return.

I cannot thank Bettina, Vita, Sima, Chef Marcellino and the entire staff enough for the memorable meal we had Saturday night. We wanted to celebrate my mother's birthday and last minute, like typical Italians, they accommodated our party of seven and got us in, rolled out the red carpet and arranged for us to enjoy the private room! If you want great wine, great service, beautiful ambiance all while enjoying the most TO DIE FOR hand crafted pasta---don't walk but run to Marcellino's! Just be sure to make a reservation, because you will never be as lucky as we were especially if it is high season. Everything on the menu is worth it-worth the money, worth the carbs and worth the calories. You only live once, ENJOY!

This is our favorite Italian restaurant in Scottsdale. There is great attention to detail in everything from the ambiance to the service. Try the handmade pasta specials and you will not be disappointed! We enjoyed the mushroom sun-dried tomato pasta with jumbo shrimp which was quite flavorful but also intrinsically simple and complementary with Marcellino's bold red sauce. Both the tiramisu and creme brûlée should not be missed. Love the outdoor patio in the heart of old town.   We did have an off night once and the ownership really went above and beyond to make it right as they've truly built an "Italiano vero" experience.  Thanks again.

This was one of the best Italian spots  I have had in years. The pasta is freshly made to order and was absolutely delicious. The ambiance is perfect for romance or a date with your child (my 9 year old that it was great) The only thing that I didn't care for was the shrimp or the clams but I'm pickier then most. I had the pasta with clams and my daughter the light pasta with shrimp cooked spicy by request. The sauce, the pasta, the service and the ambiance 5 stars all the way. Family owned and the wife was super friendly and seems to enjoy and take pride in their biz.  All in all highly recommend and will definitely come back when I'm in AZ again

It took me a very long time to find an Italian restaurant in the Phoenix area that I really enjoyed.  I had all the usual suspects in Scottsdale and Phoenix recommended to me, to varying degrees of success.  Most of them were good, but nothing that I would rather go to, than just make my own food at home.  A friend finally brought me to Marcellino's about 5 years ago, back when they were in North Phoenix (I miss that little place).    Since the first day I went, Marcellino has been serving some of the best handmade pasta that I have ever had.  But my absolute favorite are his lamb chops and filet.  With so many favorites to choose from, it's easier most days to just order the chef's tasting menu, which usually includes a duo of my some of my favorite appetizers (scallops, or mushroom polenta, or some buffalo mozzarella and tomato, etc.), a duo of pastas and a carne or a duo.    Not only is the food amazing, there is one server here in particular who always makes me feel like family, Scottie.  His knowledge of the menu, food, wine and the restaurant is flawless and his warm demeanor is incredibly welcoming.  His service takes this place a notch above the rest.

It is with pleasure that I bestow upon Marcellino Ristorante my coveted 5 star review                                                                                                                                                          *  *  * FANFARE *  *  *                    Where do I begin?  How about with the amuse busch (to build anticipation in the palette).  Moments after we received the menu a plate arrived with a couple wonderfully pungent olives, several small slices of some kind of salami and 4 small chunks of what I believe was pecorino cheese.  A delicious start and we had barely opened the menu.  We shared the Gamberi e Feta antipasti.  Two HUGE jumbo shrimp (I didn't think the word jumbo really did those bad boys justice) grilled perfectly...tender and juicy.  They were served on a square of lightly fried feta cheese and a bed of cabbage.  The arrangement was so nice that I didn't want to disturb it.  After that we shared 2 entrees:  The Fagottino di Pollo and the Salmone in Crosta di Porcini con Cognac e Porri.  I am not a big fan of salmon but I could become a fan of this salmon.  Flaky, delicious fillet with a wonderful cognac sauce.  I was less thrilled with the chicken.  It was split chicken breasts layered with proscuitto and fontina cheese and smothered in a brown sauce.  Here's the thing about the Fagottino di Pollo.  When I say I was less thrilled I mean it was 4 star chicken.  Everything else about the food and service was 5 stars.  Flat out.    We shared a couple desserts - a tirimisu and a dark chocolate mousse.  The tirimisu had all the right flavors working - mascarpone cheese, chocolate, espresso, rum, lady fingers.  Delicious.  The mousse was also very good.  Dangerously good.  Along the way we had a very well rounded chianti ( Chianti "I Sodi", Badia Morrona ) and a very nice white ( Albana "Colle Del Re" ).  Even the brewed coffee I had after dessert was very good.  Service was outstanding throughout the evening.  All in all I would place Marcellino Ristorante on the short list of Phoenix's finest restaurants.

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Props to Marcellino for making all their pasta in-house.  This is really one of the best places to get Italian in the Valley.  The lack of a 5-star review goes to value and comparison to other Italian joints.  It can get pricey here and for a lot of people, the perceived value of this place could be low.  There are other places nationwide that serve handmade pasta for a lower price point for equal to better quality.  I will say, though, that when ti comes to flavored pastas, you can actually taste what the noodle is supposed to be flavored with here, as opposed to some other Italian joints.  On our last visit, coming back to the value issue, we ordered the scallops.  They were delicious.  Perfectly cooked.  The pesto was good.  But these were 3 quite small diver scallops.  Smallest I've seen on a restaurant plate.  Again, nothing wrong with the taste, just a value issue.  We all ordered pasta dishes and every dish came out fine.  A solid al dente, maybe a little on the soft side of al dente, but still had some chew.  Never over-sauced and good balance of flavor.  Their noodles tend to be a little thicker than other places, which is fine, just different.    But compared to Rome, and some places in CA and NYC, can't give these guys 5 stars.  They are pretty good.  The value can be a little questionable, but decent handmade pasta is tough to find in the Valley.

If you are looking for authentic Italian Food,  this is the place !!! Marcellino Ristorante is a great place to enjoy true and delicious Italian home made pasta, meats and appetizers. And if you are like me and really love a phenomenal tiramisu, I promise you will find it here. Gorgeous atmosphere, great location and fabulous live entertainment  featuring Sima and her all star trio! If you're  lucky, you will also enjoy the impeccable service by server Paola - straight from Northern Italy! Buon appetito!

What an I say everything was PERFECT! Our waiter Marcos was such a sweetheart and very attentive. Our pastas were amazing and the cheesecake was so yummy and authentic. The ambiance was beautiful. AMAZING restaurant! Will be back again!!

Food is not cooked all the way,they did not wear gloves.Food not cooked all the way. Good real famous filmmakers went & had seen worker in restroom not wash their hands,so they got up & left.  When I write a review it is the truth. Restaurant needs to correct problem.DONOTREMOVE This.

Pros: cute  Nice wAit staff   Cons: price 35+ per plate Taste: bland and under done meat cooked wrong Lighting: very dark  Cold plates and food. When two plates were taken back for taste they showed up anyway on our bill When we had an issue with our food the manager only came to the table once, the chef never came out, the food was solid OK if we were at applebees this would still only be three stars  Save e $$

Wanted to take my parents out to a nice Italian dinner. It's always risky and quite difficult pleasing my dad who is an immigrant from Rome, Italy. But we thought we'd get lucky coming here.   For starters the service was extremely slow and it was a Tuesday night which wasn't busy at all.   The food was extremely pricey for what they offered.     We ordered 4 plates, 2 different pasta plates, lamb and a chicken dish. They were just good, but definitely NOT worth the steep prices, I expected so much more!!   The highlight was a delicious garlicky, red pepper bread spread and the tiramisu for dessert.   Overall wasn't crazy about our dinner experience. Probably won't be returning, considering there's plenty of other Italian options.

We have just finished a dinner at the Citizen Public House and were still not just feeling like going home yet. Maybe grabbing another drink and a little bite to eat before we go home. It was after 9pm Saturday night. We naturally strolled around Marcellino's on our way back to garage and I said: "What about trying this before we go?!" Told the hostess we are looking for a drink and maybe a little bite to eat and we would not mind sitting at the bar. She told us nothing is available for another 45 mins, and she asked if we are going to eat food...?! We said we have already finished our dinner but would not mind to taste a bit of their cuisine and inquired about sitting on a patio or at the bar. There were 3 or more 2-place seats at the bar while we were not offered either one of these. With quite a sarcastic voice she told us: WHATEVER MAKES YOU HAPPY. We have decided to follow her suggestion and left the restaurant -  which made us happy.

This place is not very good.  I went for lunch on a Saturday and it was slow.  This restaurant is between Barrio Queen and The Herb Box.  Both of those restaurants are packed on Saturday for lunch.  This place was slow; there was only my table and three others.  This should have been my first clue.  The woman who sat us had tattoos down one arm and a bad attitude.  This should have been my second clue.  The service was slow even though the restaurant was dead.  The food was awful.  We started with the mussel appetizers and the mussels were old.  We complained about it and they said that the mussels were just delivered.  I have spoken with the owners of other restaurants and they have told me that the meat distributors would sell old meat and fish to restaurant owners that didn't know what they were doing.  These people are obviously clueless.  I ordered a shrimp salad and I was told that it would come with four jumbo shrimp, the salad had three shrimp that weren't jumbo.  The cocktails were weak.  This is another place that is doomed to go out of business and it is because the owners are incompetent

Hands down my favorite for fine Italian cuisine. Chef is amazing. Friendly and attentive to his guests. Dim, beautiful ambiance. Everything is just right. Amazing wines handmade pastas and memorable service. I always have a great experience. Love talking with chef. Great date spot. Nice location. Pricy but well worth it. Get the porcini infused handmade pasta with lobster and truffle cream sauce. Life...changed. Go here, leave happy. This is real authentic fine Italian, don't expect that american imitation when you come here.

Some of the best Italian food I've ever eaten! Any time I travel to Scottsdale I must dine here. And I plan company dinner events here too. Chef and Sima and Bettina are so accommodating and engaging. Every meal I've had has felt like it was made especially for me. I recommend Marcellino to anyone and everyone I know will be anywhere near. Scottsdale. Deliizioso!

This restaurant was fantastic!!! Had one of the fresh ly made pasta dishes even though I had planned on getting a chicken dish on the menu.  It was great with crispy pancetta in a white sauce. My husband ordered a fresh pasta with a sun dried tomato sauce and shrimp...also excellent.  The tiramisu was very good, but similar to others I've had except for the flaming sugar which was fun.  Only issue is, as always, parking in that area. We were lucky enough to get the last spot in the valet lot across the street, but the trip is well worth it. We will dine there again.

This is the best Italian restaurant in Phoenix. The place is very small and cozy, and decorated very warmly inside. They have a private nook in the back corner of the restaurant, as well as a full bar. Live music is featured most nights. All of the pasta is homemade fresh daily, and is very very good. One time they had Venison on the specials menu and it was so unbelievable I swear I can still taste it. Sima and Marcellino, the owners are great people, even if Marcellino is almost impossible to understand. The place is definitely not inexpensive, but in my opinion worth eveyry penny to actually get some high end Italian that is otherwise very hard to find in Phoenix.

This is my favorite Italian restaurant anywhere!  The ambiance in this place is one of a kind.  Memories are made here.  They have live music on Thursday and Saturday nights.  We were in town for a business event. We travel here at least twice a year and always make a trip here.  You do need reservations during prime times or if you have a larger party.  We all ordered cocktails which were pretty to look at, and amazing to drink! They bring out bread with a yummy tomato butter that I could eat right out of the bowl.  They will bring out their fresh hand made pastas of the day and leave at your table to discuss. The handmade pastas are more expensive then the menu, but  they are so worth it. We all had something different to allow us to try multiple things.  They have both cream based and tomato based sauce options. There are mushroom, panchetta, prawns, lobster, baked into this pasta.  Yes, in the actual pasta!  They have a tortellini that has filet minion stuffed in it!  You read that right!!  We did not opt for the desserts this time, but they are all super yummy!  Service is incredible and environment is outstadnding.  If the weather allows, eat outside!

I took my girlfriend here for Valentine's. I couldn't have taken a better choice. The place was AWESOME!! Very cozy atmosphere, very elegant, very good food, easy access, great service, they even had a live opera singer on stage, it was a very pleasant experience! True, it was more expensive than what I had anticipated, but worthy for that very special date.

By far, this is the best place for not only food, but atmosphere and music.  The food is divine.  The restaurant is first class and the owners are like your best new friend.  I love this place! Will always bring my family, friends and even by myself.  I am always treated great.  Treat yourself!
Would have gotten 4 except for server and prices, gratuity automatically included.  Expresso was excellent, I highly recommend.  Food was tasty

Delicious! The pasta is AMAZING although very expensive for... pasta. The service is always wonderful, the staff is very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. I love sitting outside! Perfect for a romantic date night! I will definitely return and will definitely recommend!

My husband's favorite upscale Italian! (He is a noodle guy!) We have eaten there about every 4-6 weeks since we learned of it last summer! Pastas are handmade daily and are authentically Italian! I loved the set summer menu + have also loved their steak & fish! The flaming desserts are fun, along with live music nights! I loved the coffee and biscotti at the end of my meal!
great food, nice service... far location but worth it... just be carefull with the specials prices... raviloi for $32 for lunch...a lillte to much... sure I'll come back.... DELICIOSO... BRAVO...

As exquisite a fine dining experience as can be, all of that without the usual pretense that fine dining can bring. In this day and age and let's not forget, lean economic times; it is refreshing to find white tablecloth, knowledgeable wait staff, welcoming hosts etc...  Chef Marcellino and charming wife Sima did a magnificent job updating the space previously leased by gastropub Digestif. The beautiful wood stayed accented by cozy and sooth lighting.  Marcellino throws a twist to fine dining Italian that other chefs have not dared venturing to risk. Everything is made from scratch ans sure taste like it. The portions perfectly sized to allow enjoyment of all the ingredients without getting bloated.  The owners are very warm and welcoming and are very true to their craft. The kitchen is impeccable.

This place sucks. Food was average and we had to wait an hour even though we had a reservation. My americano tasted like warm soy sauce and they blamed it on the RO system. The owner made all sorts of excuses and took a whopping $50 off our $1100 bill. We won't be back!

For Arizona Restaurant Week, we selected Marcellino to try last night with friends. The restaurant itself is beautifully decorated and very inviting. Marcellino offered multiple options for a three course dinner. Most of my party started with the mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto served on top of a tomato with roasted red peppers on the side. It was a delicious twist on a caprese salad. For the main, most of us chose the Paccatela pasta. This was a short cut thick pasta noodle with a sausage ragu. It was exceptional. For dessert, our group enjoyed both the Tiramisu and the Panna Cotta. Yummy. The entire staff was attentive and personable, and Chef Marcellino even dropped by our table to welcome us. What a great meal and evening. We will definitely return.

C'mon folks, I mean you all that gave Marcellinos five stars.  This is what I found on my second trip there in three years.  You simply can not make up for the substandard value on the Lobster special I had with some music and atmosphere.  Wait staff kept calling the Lobster one half of one and a half pounds.  Cut to the chase and call it three quarters of a pound, which turned out to be two oz's of meat and 10 oz's of shell.  Home made pasta was good, sauces good, main waiter, inattentive and confusing.  For $600, I expect to be treated like we are getting ready to spend $600, (six of us).  Here is what you do with party of six: split your party into two tables so you will not be dinged for the automatic 20% tip.  Wait staff must think, HO HUM, we are going to get our 20, work for it or not.  Salad was only fair, appetizers over priced.  I have been making Cannelloni at home since 1974 that blows all the minds that have eaten it. I don't think I have ever heard anyone talk about dining out like they have reacted to sitting at my table for Cannelloni and Cesar salad.  Cesar salad by the way matched by only two restaurants in 50 years of dinning out.

A truly authentic Italian experience is waiting for you at Marcellino Ristorante. From the moment you set foot on the patio it feels like you've arrived to the most intimate and lovely Italian garden. The experience continues with handmade pastas, five-star service, and live music from the owner herself! Our evening was guided by a very informative wait staff. The courses we ordered were perfectly paired with wine selections. I had the porcini pasta with lobster tail and my better half enjoyed the pappardelle with lamb ragu. These dishes reminded us of our time in Rome, and were truly delicious! I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a high quality dining experience. The atmosphere was relaxed yet sophisticated, and I can't wait to return! Cheers to Marcellino!

I cannot say enough amazing things about Marcellinos! My boyfriend and I eat here whenever we get the chance, and since yesterday was his birthday, of course it was his only request. We always have a drink at the bar and I have to stay that the holiday drink they have was unbelievable! Please keep it on the menu.  They sat us in the little romantic cove in the wall which was super cute and cozy. We were so lucky to end up having Eric take care of us last night. His knowledge of food and wine pairing was outstanding I don't have enough good words to say and he was so friendly and passionate. We chose the beef carpaccio dish with a glass of white wine to start. Then he suggested the osso bucco for my boyfriend and I chose the tortellini but sauced with a black truffle savory sauce rather than the traditional red. And lemme tell you, these 4 giant tortellini are filled with slow roasted beef and veggies pureed together for the most amazing comforting dish. And the wine of course paired perfectly. For dessert, Eric suggested we keep it simple and clean and served us a light orange sorbet with whipped creme and caramel drizzle. Yum! The experience every time we choose Marcellinos just keeps getting better and better.

Read all the great reviews so my expectations were quite high. Unfortunately the only thing that was high were the prices. $38 for some pasta shells stuffed with something and mediocre tomato sauce. $38 for very average fish special. Nice atmoshere and good music but food was average at best

We ordered take out for my father who was just getting out of the hospital. They couldn't have been more efficient or accommodating. The food even though take out was authentic and amazing.  Portions are good- it's pricey but worth the money for a great meal and experience.   Pasta- homemade and cooked to perfection.  The veal w/Gorgonzola that my dad had put a huge smile on his face.  Pear salad not great but it was take out so I can't really judge.  Going back to dine there this weekend.

Was hoping to be blown away by homemade pasta but unfortunately we were not. IMO the gnocchi was good but the porcini infused pasta was very bland. Had to ask for and add salt, which should have been added during cooking process.  Maybe will be back but would have to be really craving italian food and if thats the case might try to look for another restaraunt.
The regular menu is average quality.  However, the special, infused pastas are spectacular (with prices to match).  Small portions but super filling.  A popular spot with locals.

You will definitely find fresh homemade pasta here. This restaurant is beautiful with a very intimate setting. I had their pasta special and it was outstanding. I paired my meal with their Italian red wine. Yum yum.

Fresh pasta and high quality ingredients make all the difference. This place has the best bucatini amatriciana, heck maybe anywhere. It isn't just good for AZ. It's actually good. Seriously this compares to east coast Italian. Everything was cooked perfectly. The party I was with consumed a great deal of wine, and seemed to approve of the list. Deserts (cheesecake, tiramisu) were also pretty great. Service was attentive.

Simply amazing.  We were greeted with warm smiles from everyone.   We did not have a reservation but space was fo bd for us.  The food. Oh. My. God.  So good!  I had ribbon pasta with a lamb ragu.  Simply amazing. Our service was over the top perfect.  I can wait to come back again.
We absolutely love Marcellino's"s. The homemade pasta is the best. We took company personal with us and they raved about it as we do. Service is wonderful. Wine list is limited but good.

ahhh Marcellino...  Why do you have to get me drunk? Funny thing is, the more we drink the more I understand your english. Thanks for the help.  There are few places in the valley that can be called true Italian, not to mention ones that are ran by a real Italian chef. Sometimes we go there and ask Marcellino to just "go for it" - havent been dissapointed yet.  BOTTOM LINE: Worth every penny! Dont change a thing.
This place was fantastic.  The food, service, ambiance, and everything else were amazing.  We especially enjoyed some of the hand made pastas, but it was all very good.

I asked for alfredo sauce here and the watier looked at me like I was the Rain Man.  The atmosphere is cool here, but the food is overpriced and it feels stuffy in here because the staff is so serious and of course stuck up since it's Snotsdale.

We love this place! We've been a few times and have always had a great time and a fantastic meal. The last time we were there, we had a strange experience with one of the waiters, he seemed completely put out, like he wanted to be somewhere else. We spoke to Sima and she assigned someone else to our table ~ everything was great!!

I LOVE this place! The staff is incredible and so knowledgeable -- not to mention they are actually from Italy. It's definitely a special-occasion place though -- not for the everyday unless you're made of cashola. Great atmosphere, great food. Also you can sign up for their e-mails which tell you about upcoming wine tastings, special menus, etc. Four thumbs up (two from me, two from hubby).

The food here was amazing. Top notch quality food and service. Jared was our waiter and he was very attentive and knowledgeable of all the entrees and wine selections. We had a spectacular time hence the 5 stars. We are definitely coming back here when we're back in town. We tried 4 of the special handcrafted pasta dishes, we were all blown away by each entree. Cheers!

The service was impeccable, the food was mediocre.  I feel the pasta could have been so much more, it just didn't live up to what I expected for the price.  Also, the plating was sloppy and uninviting.  When they charge this much for the food, and the service is as good as it is, I expect a bit more in the presentation and the development of character in the sauces.  Perhaps we just need to get something other than the pasta if we ever return.
Food was a little pricey but absolutely terrific. Only down side , on the Saturday I went , was the "entertainment" a horribly offkey "crooner"

This is my absolute favorite Italian restaurant in Phoenix.  We go here for our birthdays, anniversaries, etc... any special occasion is a reason to go to Marcellino (or just no occasion other than date night)!  What do we love?  The fresh pasta presentation at the beginning of the meal is so fun.  The food is always exceptionally tasty.  The ambiance is lovely.  The owner and his wife walk around the restaurant to ensure that everyone is enjoying their meal - and everyone always looks very happy.  The have live music on most nights as well which makes the entire space feel very intimate.  They also have this great private booth you can reserve for special occasions.    I can't say enough good things about Marcellino.  It's our "GO TO" place in Phoenix.

We we're Recommended Marcellino's from our concierge at the Four Seasons. It was  a delicious home made tasting, Italian cuisine meal. The atmosphere relaxing with Italian music playing. Our waiter Marco was friendly, knowledgeable and had great recommendations. We try a different Italian restaurant every year we visit Scottsdale, but our group will definitely return to Marcellino. Best Italian found.

I first went to Marcellino Ristorante, on a recommendation from strangers, by playing hookie when I was a sophomore in college, not long after they'd opened.   It was an expensive lunch, since I had three courses and ordered one of their specials, but it was very good, and Sima, who runs the front of the place, was delightful.   I came back a couple times and was just blown away by how good everything was. My early enthusiasm was borne out with its various New Times awards, and it has been my pleasure since then to turn many satisfied people on to what is without a doubt the best Italian restaurant in Arizona, and in my opinion one of the best overall.   The place's new location does it justice, although those of us prone to nostalgia miss the old one. I spent most of the last three years overseas, and when I was back visiting home, Marcellinos was always my top priority, and never disappointed me.   Everything that they make is excellent, though I'm particularly attached and addicted to their thick, short, toothsome Pacatelli pasta with ragu di salsiccia , which is generously available at a discount for lunch.    I don't know whether or not anyone can say that it is "perfect" pasta, but I would wager a lot that there is no pasta that is better. It is flawless. As close to the platonic ideal as we can get.   The same could probably be said of their tiramisu.   Unfortunately it's not possible anymore to spend an afternoon drinking wine and espresso and smoking cigars on their patio, but that was only ever just icing on the cake.

My husband and I dined here a couple of months ago while visiting Scottsdale. We discovered this place through Yelp and we were not disappointed at all!  We came here on a Saturday evening, with out a reservation. The dining area was packed so we sat at the bar.... which is where we love to sit at anyway.  The bartender and waitstaff were more than accommodating and the service was impeccable.  Our bartender, Troy, was informative and very helpful..... and his recommendations were on point.   We especially love that the menu focuses on their infused fresh pasta.  All of the dishes were delicious! We had ravioli, linguini with clams, tuna carpaccio and shrimp scampi.... all of which were tasty and scrumptious.   After dessert, Troy joined us with a shot of their house made Limoncello. We will definitely return to Marcellino's during our next Scottsdale visit. Vino cheers dear diners!!

They say first impressions are sometimes wrong. I say you can figure out how the establishment is even with a simple order 'to go'.   I called the restaurant on a Thursday night around 6 and spoke with Logan who put me on hold for 10 minutes. After that, I simply hung up and called again. A different person answered the phone and courteously took my order of spaghetti clams with white sauce. I remembered repeating the word SPAGHETTI since I didn't want anything else with the clams. I knew they had their dish called "Scialatielli" clams however I figured no Italian restaurant in town would be out of spaghetti. I also asked what the soup of the day was and the waitress didn't even know. Bad. At 6 o'clock your shift should have begun already. Not knowing what their soup du jour is already makes me not want to order it. Indeed I stuck with the spaghetti only.   After all this journey, I get to the restaurant and my order was ready. Good. But it was not what I ordered. The lady I spoke with did indeed put the Scialatielli with clams, which is more of a fat over cooked chewy version of the linguine with a little bit of red sauce. Too bad I didn't check on the moment. I would have sent it back and not paid for it.   What it pissed me more is that they really TRIED TO FOOL ME!! SCIALATIELLI IS NOT SPAGHETTI! The waitress came to me and with an attitude of an arrogant said that Scialatielli is the Italian word for spaghetti. NO. YOU BACK UP AND YOU SHUT UP!! I'm from Italy my dear, authentically FROM Italy. I was born and raised in Milan, been here for 3 years, my last name is Petrucci and I absolutely do not accept this prank.  Scialatielli might be a Southern Italian dialect for spaghetti. But it's not even close to it. In Italiano si dice spaghetti. Gli Scialatielli li conoscete solo voi!!!   If you didn't have spaghetti, I would have MUCH APPRECIATED YOUR HONESTY, instead of making me pay $25 (plus tip cause I personally always tip) for a lousy pasta dish.   I've heard the owner is from Benevento, perhaps she should go back there to make those Scialatielli. I would have hold my opinion if the food was good. But after the outrageous customer service, I cannot be silent.   No one likes to be made a fool of. I will do my best to DEFAME your business.

Sometimes it's more than just the food at the restaurant! You can't really ignore the setting, decor and ambiance of this place. It's literally nestled in Old Town near the galleries and sunken below the street level. It's surrounded by wine art-like bottles coming out of concrete walls and fountains, wrought iron, and shrubs and greenery. I mean, you could get engaged here it's so beautiful and romantic! ME, however; I'm there for the food! And it's tadiefawr!! We had the special appetizer which was a Buffalo mozzarella with prosciutto and olive oil drizzle. Salads were fresh and crisp. I went with the veal scalopine and it was incredible. They offered options and variations of some dishes which gave you the ability to mix and create a  little. I would love to try sometime for lunch. There was music on the patio outside but we were in the restaurant area. Now that it has cooled down, I would go back and sit outside. I bet it's amazing! The waiters and wait staff are sophisticated and educated on their dishes so talk them up and get their feedback. This is probably now one of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale for sure for the whole experience. Unforgettable!

Best Italian food in Arizona!  Excellent ambience, fantastic and friendly staff. Good for a romantic or dinner with friends.  Marcellino likes to walk through the dining room and great the guests once or twice during the evening adding a nice touch to the experience.

Went for New Year's Eve and it was nice to not have a prix fixe menu at a place with live music. We were sitting inside then went outside due to how loud the music was and a singer that wasn't the very best. Sitting outside was much better with the heaters on; it was very comfortable. I ordered the Scaloppine Gorgonzola which was very good, thinly sliced veal in a wonderful sauce that came with carrots (that were a little too crunchy), zucchini and broccolini. My husband had the caprese salad which he liked but the roasted peppers were so bitter that he couldn't eat those and after trying myself agreed. I was surprised that they wanted to charge us for the bread but the waiter took it off the bill since they only had a baguette on NYE and he raved on how good the focaccia bread was but then realized they weren't serving it. For dessert we ordered tiramisu which was good with a nice presentation of a flaming sugar cube. Service was good, attentive but not overbearing. What was strange is after our entree the waiter asked if he could bring back our compliments to the chef. We were dumbfounded and taken by surprise no restaurant had ever asked us that before.

The two stars I'm giving are primary for the mediocre food and the chef. The service was great- so 5 stars for that.  I only eat pasta that is made fresh and in house, and I can 100% say this place is overpriced basic bitch pasta. The texture of the squid ink pasta was largely unimpressive, it could have been grocery store linguine. I ordered the squid ink pasta not for the novelty (I've had it before) but for the seafood preparation that went along with it, as they have a rigid pasta regimen. It had lobster and calamari with it.  The seafood was perfectly cooked, but unfortunately the chef refused to make a different sauce to go with pasta.   Typically, I would be ok with that, that is.. if the dish is going to blow my mind. But..if I'm being honest, the regular old red sauce tasted like Classico straight off the shelf of my local Safeway.  I'm not sure what the stink was with regard to not switching up the sauce...it might have saved the mundane texture of the pasta.   I'm not sure if maybe the other pastas actually taste like fresh, made in-house pasta? this tasted like maybe it was made a week or two prior..fresh pasta should be soft but al dente with just the right amount of silky chewiness. this pasta was a bit too dense and hard for me believe it is made daily in house. If it is, I am content to know that I can get the same dish by just hitting up bucca di Beppo for less money. And they'll probably make it with the sauce I want.   Won't be going back to this place! Hoping to find a better local joint for good, fresh made pasta.

Some of the best Italian food I have ever had. This is a favorite for my wife and I. Sima and Marcellino are very nice people, very inviting. The bar is small but fun to hang out at. The food is always fresh and delicious.  Watch out for Marcellino - he likes to push the truffles.

The food and service was good. The reason why I give 2 stars is because of their menu. First of all I don't understand all this 95 cents in the menu. $14.95, $18.95, $24.95... Is it a fine dining restaurant or Walmart? That's a turn off because it's kind of cheap. Any expensive restaurant you go to they all have menu with even numbers. Another turn off was when I saw that they charge $3 for ice. Seriously??? This is embarrassing. They also have only one bathroom which is very inconvenient and it was dirty. For $200 dinner there are much better restaurants out there. We won't come back.

An associate and myself took some of our best clients to dinner while attending the UnitedPlanners Conference in Scottsdale. What a great experience. Happen to have live music and the food was fantastic. Clients loved it as well.

What a wonderful dining experience as my wife and I celebrated 30 years of marriage at this upscale Italian restaurant.  We opted for the Monday night three course chefs special with the wine paring.  There was a bit of mixup as the Internet price ($49 p/p) did not reflecrt the price increase after their move to the new location.  However after a short  discussion, the Internet price was honored.   After the complimentary bruchetta, our first wine was presented to us - a lovely chianti blend that introduced our first course.  The first course had two very different offerings.  A wonderful mushroom sauce was served over Polenta - this was my favorite.  The other offering in the first course was traditional Insalata Caprese - mozzarella, local tomatoes and basil.  Both of these dishes were perfect. The second course was preceded by a local Tuscany red wine that was a blend of 4 grapes.  This pasta course was highlighted by a delicious white seven cheese ravioli complimented with a red sausage and marinara  pasta dish.  All of their pastas are home made and were cooked to perfection.  The ravioli was my favorite!  The main course consisted of two fillets of a Mediterranean fish that was a member of the Monk fish family.  It was served with a yummy garlic sauce and accented by perfectly mashed white potatoes dressed with fresh Basil.   The evening was romantic and the service was just right.  We had a wonderful dining experience in this Anniversary stopover in Scottsdale.

The reason I give one star is because I can't give zero. Had arranged a dinner last night for three couples and anticipated a nice evening. This was destroyed by Marcellino. My wife, sitting next to me, had ordered calves liver for her entree. She was served chicken by one of the wait staff. It was sent back, only to be returned to her by our waitress, who argued that was what she had ordered (my friend sitting next to me and I both knew differently). It was finally decided, with some difficulty, that the chicken would be replaced with the liver. Imagine our surprise when she was served veal. At that point, my wife was so angry that we cancelled her dinner. The waitress and the manager apologized and even offered to serve us desert (in which none of us had any interest) without charge. We declined.   We were treated poorly and with little other than a perfunctory apology and offer of free desert. My wife left hungry and angry. My meal was indifferent but I just left angry. My friends were truly surprised by the level of service and particularly by the seeming apathy towards the repeated mistakes. I suppose I should be grateful that we were not charged for her dinner.   Obviously, we will not be back.   After posting this review, I received a response from the owner and wife of the chef inviting my wife and me to be their guests at a dinner to demonstrate their passion and commitment to fine dining.  While I appreciate the invitation, I will point out that the six people at our table all shared in the disappointment and the poor attitude of those who served us.   If the other couples are invited as guests, we will accept the invitation. Otherwise we will decline. I don't believe my wife nor I would wish to face the scowl I received from the chef when I cancelled her order without reinforcement.

My fiancé and I were in town for a golf tournament and since we wanted Italian, I searched Yelp for "Best Italian Scottsdale"...Marcellino came up in the results and boy...am I glad they did!  Upon entering, I was immediately impressed by the décor and ambiance. This place is great for a first date or any other romantic/special occasion.    Our server was warm, friendly and very attentive (sorry, I don't remember his name but he is from New Orleans) - he made our dining experience very enjoyable.    My fiancé thoroughly enjoyed his veal dish and I opted for salmon (which was delicious by the way).  We also had a side of the home made sundried tomato pasta (DON'T PASS UP THE PASTA)!   This is hands down the best Italian food I've had since leaving the east coast.  If you are looking for authentic Italian food, don't pass them up!

Restaurant Week Fall 2015  Terry T and I went here with non-Yelper Julie on Monday, Sept. 21 and had a truly outrageous meal. Everything we ordered was split between the three of us.  We started out splitting the mozzarella and prosciutto, polenta al funghi and scallops con pesto. I ate them in that order, because I knew--while all should be delicious--the scallops would be amazing. And they were, on all accounts. The mozzarella was fresh, served with roasted red peppers and fresh tomato; grilled polenta fries surrounded perfectly sautéed mushrooms; and the scallops were perfectly cooked and rested in the best pesto I've had in my life!  Next course: ravioli del giorno, gnocchi Sorrentina, and filettino al tartufo. Same eating pattern applied here. Three huge (like, the size of my hand) raviolis stuffed with spinach and ricotta [if I'm remembering right] and a brown butter sauce were easily split between our group. The brown butter sauce was a bit understated, but otherwise was a really good dish. The gnocchi--dang, I love gnocchi--were tender and cradled in a delicate tomato sauce. I'm generally not a huge red sauce fan but this was executed wonderfully. Finally, the medium-rare grilled filet was mouth-watering and the Barolo reduction was decadent.  Wrapping up our meal, we ordered two servings of tiramisu and one panna cotta. In hindsight, we'd probably order two panna cotta if we were able to do it again. Not that the tiramisu was divine; it's just we had a harder time sharing the panna cotta. Both were fantastic, I assure you.  We also checked out there non-Restaurant Week offerings and will be heading back for those.

Food sounded great on the menu. Presentation was good. The staff was great. I got the pork with brown sauce, it had almost no flavor. The potatoes were very bland and seemed like box potatoes. For an appetizer I got the Ahi on Arugala. I expected a thicker slice, it came out so thin, you could almost see thru it. Overall. I would never come back.

This was a very nice experience in Scottsdale. The ambiance was great they had a band which was a little to loud it was sometimes hard to talk but other than that it was very nice inside. They had indoor and outdoor seating available. The service was very good and our food was excellent. The handcrafted pastas are the best! Great Italian food!
